review.reviewBody: I've had these mittens for about two months and worn them in temps ranging from 25F to - 15F. Overall they have performed well. My hands did get a little cold at the lower temps, but I have Reynaud's Syndrome. The mitts fit well and are true to size. My only complaint are the wrist straps. They are much too short and almost impossible to close. I cut the strap off and now they are "almost" perfect.
review.name: Great mittens

review.reviewBody: I like these mittens a lot, especially that there's a finger section within the mitten part. They're warm except that I noticed if I'm just standing around my fingertips get cold. When I'm skiing though, my hands are toasty :)
review.name: Nice mittens but need to keep moving

review.reviewBody: I returned these as I didn't realize they had an inbuilt fingers within the mitt. I have Renault's and need an open mitt so I can hold a hand warmer in my palm to manage circulation in my fingers. Cute design though!
review.name: Glove in mitts clothing

review.reviewBody: Not great mitts as my hands get cold in them in about 15min. As an avid snowboarder here in Canada I have experience with what a mitt should be. I would not recommend these... they maybe ok for a California winter. The pull loops at the cuffs get stuck to the Velcro and start to look shabby in about a week. The wrist leash is nice and it does work with a touchscreen. But if you want warm hands these are not for you.
review.name: My hands get cold

review.reviewBody: Can confirm, these are definitely waterproof! Spent over an hour playing with my dog in the snow and my hands are bone dry. Not only that but they’re warm! Hands are actually a little sweaty lol. I’m 5’7” 140 pounds and am ALWAYS cold in the winter. I measured my hands carefully using the manufacturer suggestions and they fit true to size. These are definitely worth the extra money. Only downside is the velcro along the cuff. Won’t last long, wish it was just cinched at the cuff.
review.name: WORTH IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Took these gloves on a late season walk hunt. Snowed several of the days. These gloves kept my hands warm no matter what I was doing. I fully recommend them to everyone!
review.name: Didn't just keep my hands warm, warmed them from being cold!

review.reviewBody: I love that they are waterproof, warm, and cozy but why the velcro, so cheap and if you do not keep it latched it tears at everything esp those cheap tethers that they come with. Come on OR do better.
review.name: Warm but why the velcro?

review.reviewBody: I have gone through close to 10 pairs of gloves as my fingers get super cold on dog walks/ Skiiing, but these gloves...., changed my life. No more crying after dog walks or skiing on a super cold day. Best investment ever. Hope they make a glove version of it, but the mittens work. Have recommended this to several friends, and will gift this to my family next month. Would give this 100 stars..
review.name: BEST GLOVES EVER!!! PLEASE BUY THIS ONE!!

review.reviewBody: I measured my hands prior to ordering these mittens, however, they are much too long - especially the thumb. In addition, I am a female with a small wrist and it would be impossible to fully close the Velcro "hook" portion around my wrist. They do seem like they would be very warm, but I am sending them back.
review.name: Returning these

review.reviewBody: I've had these mittens for a couple of years now, and they're hands down my favorite. They're cozy and warm and easy to get on even when my fingers are freezing. I work at the local ski hill and need to be out in the elements even when it's storming/raining. These never let me down. I would buy them again and again. I usually wear XS but got a small in these and they're perfect.
review.name: My favorite mittens

name: Stormbound Sensor Mitten

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. Still stretching out to accommodate bunions. Then will be excellent.
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: Nice comfortable kick around shoes .not much support I could not wear them to work in all day since I’m on my feet all day (hairstylist) but easy to get on and I have the bright purple pair I bought 4pairs of new balance that day and they all have different support ,I’ll definitely be staying with new balance for awhile. Only 4 stars since I feel they could have more arch support
review.name: Great day off shoe

review.reviewBody: I love them, very comfortable and colors was perfect
review.name: New Balance

review.reviewBody: Although these Minimus Trail shoes are better than all the "Marshmallow" soled shoes being sold now,I miss the old trail shoes. I bought 5 pairs and have worn the soles off them, and I was hoping these would be the same.  I am not a fan of the huge heel sole sticking out the back,but I sort of like the stretchy heel fabric.  The Footbed itself is comfortable and they lace up nicely.
review.name: Miss the old Minimus Trail

review.reviewBody: Like others, I rushed out to buy this new Minimus, thinking it was similar to the old version (of which I've had over ten pairs and loved).  These fit wider and feel much cheaper than the old ones.  The biggest disappointment is that they have WAY too much sole to be considered a minimalist shoe and don't allow any feel for the ground.  Hoping NB brings back the older style.
review.name: Not the traditional Minimus

review.reviewBody:
I have a similar sentiment to a lot of the other reviews - I was so excited to see that New Balance brought back the minimus trail and rushed to order one. It's a decent show in its own right but it's not the minimus trail. The sole is much too reinforced. Hopefully the next iteration is closer to the last because it was the best shoe I've ever had.

Also, the lip on the heal is odd. I do appreciate having a mostly black color option.
review.name: Please bring back the previous Minimus Trail(s)

review.reviewBody: I wanted to replace my old minimus trail runners, I have had 12 pairs.   These aren’t those
review.name: Not my fav

review.reviewBody: Was   hoping for a return of the my favorite shoes. The design changed and these do not fit as well, large and sloppy compared to the old style. The previous style kept your toes from sliding forward on down hills better. These also tend to hurt my hips after an hour.
review.name: Not as good as the old style minimus

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and fits like a glove. Sole is a lot thicker than the old minimus. But this shoe is a good alternative
review.name: New Minimus

review.reviewBody: Love the way shoes fit and look. I do miss the old minimus sole that used to be more inline with minimus but NB takes customer feedback seriously and I understand most folks want a bit more sole. The company took that feedback and provided a great shoe for the many
review.name: Sharp look, comfortable shoe

name: Minimus Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great color and comfort. I should have gone one size up but only because I like tops very loose. It is pretty thin, so perfect for a boat ride!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I wear these shirts all week long- I'm ready for anything
review.name: it's my go to!

review.reviewBody: I bought this hoodie as well as the Women's Bamboo Lightweight Hoodie II. I only wanted one hoodie, and I ended up returning this one since it was more expensive and heavier in weight. It was lovely, though, and if money was no option, I would have liked to keep it!
review.name: Great hoodie

review.reviewBody: Everything about this shirt is perfect! I burn very easily but love to hike and be outside. I probably wont use the hood much but it’s there if I need it. The shirt is very flattering, very very soft and the length is just right.
review.name: Another perfect shirt!

review.reviewBody: This is a great item to have for layering or worn all by itself. I don't get warm wearing it (great soft fabric)even in hot Southern temperatures. In fact, I like putting the hood up over my hat to avoid getting my neck sunburn specially if windy. Optional hand extension over hands with thumb hole to prevent sunburn. Color arrived looking more grey than photographed (blue). But it's very neutral color goes with anything if needed for added warmth or weather becomes chilly.
review.name: Love this Hooded Shirt

review.reviewBody: Seriously so light and comfortable. A little smoother/heavier material than the bamboo lightweight hoodie but still really nice to wear even in warm weather. Per the website, dries more quickly than the bamboo lightweight but didn't actually put this to the test. Definitely would recommend.
review.name: Love this sun hoodie

review.reviewBody: Love how light-weight and well-fitting this is! Ordering in another color ASAP!
review.name: Perfect Fit!

review.reviewBody: Love the color and fit! Lightweight and true to size.
review.name: Love this hoodie!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and functional. I'm typically a size medium and I went with a medium, it was perfect. I'm 5' 5 and I weigh 140. Hope that helps some of the other ladies out there.
review.name: Super Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Quality material, nice fit. Excellent protection from the sun.
review.name: Women's Elevate Hoodie - Heather Tide Pool

review.reviewBody: I was blown away by the fit of these shoes. I wear a 42 (mens) in Sportiva Solutions - not super snug performance fit but slightly snug and ordered a 9.5 (42.5) in these shoes and they fit perfectly. They appear to be narrow but stretch out to the width of your foot perfectly. Worthy cop for sure.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody:
I bought this shoe as my first Unparallel when my other shoes were not working well for me on small footholds bouldering outside.  I tried half size down but it was a little unbearable for me, street size fit well but a bit painful.  Now that they are broken in the upper is a hair loose but my toes and heels are still great.  This shoe has stiff enough soles to get very good holds on tiny edges outside, with rubber that seems to have unlimited grip on rock.  After a few sessions they will soften enough to smear, it's hard to imagine a better outdoor bouldering shoe than this one.  My confidence outside has skyrocketed and I'm sending harder stuff every time I go out. Highly recommend this shoe for folks with narrower heels and toes for outdoor bouldering.

I imagine this shoe would also do well inside but I picked up Flagships for that since indoor rarely has edges those won't handle.
review.name: Outstanding outdoor bouldering shoe

name: TN Pro Shoe

review.reviewBody: Great rope for sport climbing and saves a lot of weight for the approach or walk off. It has a nice dynamic elongation similar to the Lightning Pro that gives soft catches, but, unlike the Lightning Pro, it doesn't stretch out too much for the top rope climbers' fall. It does fray a little at the sheath quicker than some other ropes, but I'm not surprised from a 9.2mm. Might not be the best fit for those jaggy multipitch climbs were the rope has a lot of contact with the rock.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Thule RideAlong in April 2020. My son was around 15 months at the time and I was very excited about cycling around town with him. The product worked exceptionally well for the first year. It was robust, comfortable for my son, felt very safe, and made cycling so much more fun. Additionally, it was easy to install and required very little maintenance (I would clean it with warm water every now and then, but that was it!). After a year, the left foot strap snapped off. As annoying as this was at first, I will say that I had cycled hundreds of miles with my son when this happened so I figured it was fair wear and tear (I will also say, parenthetically, that my son never kicked his feet around while we cycled so losing the strap didn't cause any safety issues for us--that being said, I could see how this would be a potential problem for others). After two and a bit years of use--which aligned with my son hitting the maximum weight limit of the product as stated by Thule--I stopped using the RideAlong. Oddly, this is when the real major problem of the product became apparent. When I disassembled the RideAlong, I realized that the mounting bracket had squashed the seat tube on my steel bike. I was very shocked to see this, especially considering that I had made sure that I tightened the mounting bracket screws to the correct torque measurements as specified by Thule. (To the extent it is of interest to the reader, I own quite good torque wrenches that I get calibrated every year or so to make sure that they stay accurate for my bike mechanic and maintenance needs so I am very confident that there is no problem with the wrenches. In fact, I do quite a lot of work on my bikes and use the wrenches frequently. I have had no issues with any of the bike components that I used the wrenches on.) The three stars that I give this product is meant to be a reflection about the contradictory nature of this review: on the one hand, the product was very good, but on the other, I was not expecting a damaged bike as a result of its use. Ultimately, because of the latter, I would not recommend purchasing this product. I think Thule need to provide potential customers with a warning about possible bike frame damage as a consequence of the use of the RideAlong.
review.name: A good product that led to a bad problem

review.reviewBody: We bought this a month ago and have used it several times. I like that the buckle fits over the kids helmet. It seems easy to adjust as we‘ll be using it with two kids. It’s pretty expensive with the recent increase in price but I imagine we will be using it for many years.
review.name: Happy with it

review.reviewBody: i have bought the tule ride along and Yepp and you have to have a thule bike in order for these products to work ( thule bikes dont exist) You either have a hit or miss when buying child bike seats. Very complicated.  Just buy a kids bike trailer and pull them with out worrying about screwing your head (Literally so many screws)
review.name: Buy a bike trailer
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule Yepp Maxi. I'm sorry it did not fit your bike and family needs. 
Thule child bike seats are not designed for specific bikes, but do have a range of measurement requirements of the frame and bike to ensure a safe and secure fit. These measurements are listed in the user manuals, which are available in the Downloads section of the Thule product page. You can also find information on Thule bike seat fitment on the following FAQ page. 
https://help.thule.com/s/article/How-do-I-know-if-a-Yepp-or-RideAlong-child-bike-seat-will-fit-my-bike-en-us?language=en_US

review.reviewBody: This product obviously is very well built. Unfortunately after all the headache of ordering/waiting/trying to find information i came to the conclusion through trial and error that this product (even with the low saddle adapter) simply does not work with a Trek Xcaliber 8 29er. Such an absolute shame. Was really hoping this would work. Another 3-4” with the low saddle adapter and it would have work.
review.name: Would work if it fit.
comment:
Thank you for reaching out. 
I'm sorry to hear the Thule RideAlong did not fit your bike. Mountain bike geometry can make it more difficult to fit a child bike seat as they are generally not designed for adding accessories. 
The bike measurements needed for a safe fit are listed in the Thule RideAlong user manual, which is downloadable from the Thule.com product page. You can compare those measurements to your bike to see if the seat will be compatible prior to purchase.

review.reviewBody: This product cracked my bike frame. The fact that this should not be used with a carbon bike frame was not listed in the User Manual, so be aware.
review.name: Do Not Use With a Carbon Frame!
comment:
Hello David, 
I understand your frustration with the damage to your bike frame. While carbon frames are called out specifically in the user manual, Thule does recommend checking your bike and contacting the bike manufacturer to ensure it is compatible with a Thule child bike seat.
Thule is always looking for ways to improve communication with customers, so this feedback is appreciated and has been communicated to the product development team.

review.reviewBody: Best rear child's bike seat on the market, in my estimation.  Easy on / easy off for me, comfortable for the grandkids, solidly built; what else is there?  Pricey but worth it.
review.name: Outstanding seat

review.reviewBody: This seat is solid and just very well designed.  I expected my daughter to be nervous in it but she was not.  She just kept saying "more".
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: Good seat except we recently had a minor bike accident and my 2 year old fell out of the seat on to the ground because the harness failed. Basically the strap broke during the fall and when we got up he was on the ground. Poor guy has a bruise and a scrape on his elbow. Feel like maybe it's time to rethink this design.
review.name: Harness fails

review.reviewBody: I have a fat tire bike(Mongoose Malus) so positive clearance from wheels was crucial. After initial installation, the seat had contact with tires once loaded, so bought the Low Saddle Adapter to gain about 3 more inches in seat height.  The width opening for the fat tires was perfect.  I have used the RideAlong with my two year old for about two month.  The recline feature is great, it is easy to assemble and it is very convenient for quick removal.  Unfortunately the child seat as such is missing a key safety feature, which is the buckle strap across the chest, which prevents kids from slipping their arms out of from harness.  Luckily any type of chest strap will help solve this issue(I used one from an old car seat we had), but for the price point, it should be included in the RideAlong.
review.name: Needs chest buckle strap - Strong Product Otherwis

review.reviewBody: Before we purchased this seat we watched YT and  did research. We decided to go with this model vs the older one. You can adjust the angle of the seat, the straps are soft and are more comfortable for a kid. It’s easier to adjust the straps comparing to the older model. The back part of the seat supports neck for a long time ( unless your child is very tall).  The seat is very easy to install. It took a while for my husband to get used to extra weight on the back. Very pleased with this purchase. Hopefully it will last for a long time for other kids to enjoy.
review.name: Excellent choice

name: Chariot RideAlong Child Bike Seat

review.reviewBody: I bought MR products years ago and wanted to make sure the quality was still top notch before I ordered a higher cost product so I ordered this.  Great bag for toiletries so I gave it to my son who loves it.
review.name: Great Quality

review.reviewBody: Got both sizes of the spiff kits. I use one for small electronics, chargers, power bank, etc. The other is serving as my toiletries kit for travel. Couldn’t be happier with either. The waxes canvas is great.
review.name: Great little bags!

review.reviewBody: Awesome bag for charging cords, keeps everything organized

review.reviewBody: I really like this bag it’s my favorite. I ordered several different ones I like it so well I’m gonna order the large size for my personal use for just general travel. You knocked it out of the park mystery ranch with this one.
review.name: Great little bag

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my husband and he really likes it.
review.name: Very nice and well made

review.reviewBody: Excellent build with plenty of compartments and zippers.
review.name: Great size and quality!

review.reviewBody: Quality built! Good item storage options! Can’t wait to take it on a trip!
review.name: Great design!

review.reviewBody: I've had this kit for about a month now and have used it on a two-week road trip and an overnight car camping trip.  It's durable and swallows more than I expected it to, and kept pills, sprays, toothbrushes and other smaller items well organized.  I'd recommend it for anyone who needs a small toiletries kit or a place for extra items beyond a larger kit.  The fabric and materials are definitely higher quality and catch less (on toothpaste tube corners, for example) than my other dopp kit, making this one pleasant to use.  Great organization options in a small case, too.
review.name: Small size is great minimalist dopp kit

review.reviewBody: I brought this as a toiletry bag for my deployments as a firefighter.  It is great and recommend to anyone looking for one.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Great accessory for a shaving kit but I turned it into a medical bag. Works great for organizing things. One side is for trauma the other is for boo boos. Just like everything by mystery ranch great quality.

description: Buy the Salomon MTN Pure Touring Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MTN Pure Touring Binding - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon MTN Pure Touring Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I wish that Salomon made this more clear in their description of the crampon system. These bindings are absolutely incompatible with Dynafit bindings, regardless of what you read in review articles. The Dynafit crampon bar is too wide for the MTN bindings and the level of force required to attach the crampons is likely to cause the crampon to fail. Just cut to the chase and buy the proprietary crampon for these bindings. Otherwise this binding has served me well so far.
review.name: 100% Not Compatible with Dynafit Bindings

review.reviewBody: Solid bindings. Simple design that is easy to use. Unsure if the risers will become floppy with further use.
review.name: Dig these bindings.

review.reviewBody: Got out 4 times this season and I am really pleased. They're light, fast in transition and so overall simple. I've heard of the riser issue without having this problem yet. I guess simply replacing the rivet by a bolt eventually will fix it
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Got these for my touring setup. Very pleased with the engagement and weight. Only been out on them once so far but looking forward to more vertical on them.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I have many many tours under my belt with this binding and I love 'em.  Great for climbing, great for transitions, great for skiing... except that after some use the top risers are so loose that they just flop around, creating some v. awkward situations.  Would love to get a fix for this!!  I would recommend with reservation only on this one issue.
review.name: Great but for sloppy riser situation

review.reviewBody: I love this binding! However, buyer be aware that the heel riser gets floppy and this causes problems when skinning. I will be on relatively flat terrain and the motion of bringing my foot forward will cause the heel plate to be in the highest setting, it’s a bummer.
review.name: Excellent, until the heel riser gets floppy.
comment:
Thank you for your feedback. Here, at Salomon, we always appreciate hearing what customers have to say about our products!
We´re sorry to hear about the issue with the product. Please, expect to be contacted shortly by our team, we would like to help in any way we can!

review.reviewBody: I've been using Salomon Tech bindings since they first made it with 100+ days per year, and not one issue yet.  They are simple and they just work.
review.name: Best Tech Binding

review.reviewBody: Great binding, but after few years of use the heel risers on both binding have broken. On the positive note, they work well on transition, and I never had any issues on the descent. Just their durability could be improved.
review.name: Good- but could be better
comment:
We apologize for all the inconvenience with your Salomon product. Please note that we have a two-year warranty on all our hardgood products. If you qualify for the warranty, please submit all the necessary information at the following link.
https://www.salomon.com/en-ca/shop/contact/warranty

review.reviewBody:
Bought these binding for the 2020 season. I love how light and simple they are to use. I have used these in all conditions, deep pow, braker crust, corn, steep icy couloirs. 

They appear to be pretty durable, except the wing that holds onto the ski crampon broke off. This was the second time that i had used ski crampons with this binding.

I charge hard, and they have never pre-released. Then in Jan, while skiing way up in AK, was skiing a big line, hit an old avalanche crown in some bad lighting, lost control, fell and tomahawked. Ski finally releases on the 3rd rotation. Long story short, i have to endure 2 surgeries and have a year or recovery. I will not be skiing these bindings again.
review.name: Simple, Light... But did not release

review.reviewBody: I've run this binding for two season's now and love it. Light, simple design, easy enough to step in to, never had any problem coming out of them on the downhill - they release.  My previous bindings were G3 and they broke twice in the same season - it was a serious hassle working with their customer service department to resolve the issue. Nothing but love for salomons.
review.name: Best touring binding I've used

name: MTN Pure Touring Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: I need sun shields for all sides as in the summer it is too hot for my dog
review.name: bark ranger

review.reviewBody: This bag is so helpful! We store all of our extra leashes, water, bowels, treats, and poop bags. Such a useful little addition.
review.name: Very Nice Addition

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a Bark Ranger XL. IMO a storage bag is essential gear but it doesn’t need to be this bag. I had a limited amount of time to get the stroller kitted out so I just purchased this bag even though the price is ridiculous for what you get. It seems decently made but I’m sure there are some better designed options out there if you have time to look. This is unstructured and if you’re not careful items can easily roll out seeing how the bag rests on the angled roof. The size is good enough to hold water bottle, doggie wipes, spare leash, phone, keys, and more. I primarily the center large compartment. The side ones are quite narrow but fit small items well enough.
review.name: Just okay

review.reviewBody: I carry a water bottle & dish, treats, small frisbee, etc. and is conveniently stored there between bike rides. The leash is stored in the side pocket of my Bark Ranger.
review.name: A well made useful addition

review.reviewBody: This makes a nice addition to the Bark Ranger. It stays on securely and holds lots of extras. We use it for water and a leash, but there’s still room for more.
review.name: Nice addition

hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Dirt Roamer 20L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This bag isn’t great. It’s soft and has no structure in the back which makes it slump down on your back when you have the hydration bladder filled. The storage configuration is also not ideal, if you want to get anything it all falls out and it seems to hold way less than my other 20L bag. The back is also not breathable which causes you to sweat bad and I’m not a sweaty guy. 

The hip pockets and the detachable hydration tube are about the only things I’d keep from this thing. Overall a disappointment that’s made from quality materials. The construction is quality but the concept and design are garbage. I bought a different bag due to the lack of storage and the lack of utility on this.
review.name: Not Patagonias best idea

review.reviewBody: The pecfect light weight bag for swim fins , towel water snacks when I’m biking to the beach . Love it !!
review.name: Super Sweet Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this primarily to use for commuting to and from work - anything from 15 to 30 miles; replacing my Osprey Raptor. I actually use the bladder storage area to put my PC and it fits great (unlike the Raptor) and does not move around. There is no divider of any sort in the main compartment other than a key lanyard. However this has not bothered me and I am easily able to find my gear and equally I have no issues with bike repair tools, spare tubes, clothes and food from moving around. The double zipper means you can open up the main compartment and easily find what you are looking for, versus a top entry zipper on some packs which means you have to rummage around "blind" for what you are looking for. Side pockets on waist belt hold snacks and other items. Zips are all smooth and material construction is very good, and pack is equally light-weight. So for my needs, it is working great. I have not used the bladder so cannot comment. I bought the size small and I am 5' 8". Fits great. I did try the large and it would ride up the back of my neck, so small was definitely the right choice for me.
review.name: Great pack at a killer deal

review.reviewBody:
Love this pack, nice and comfy with a great waistband to keep the off your shoulders. One recommendation, replace the mouthpiece before you head out. The hose is ok, however the mouthpiece snapped off on the first stress test, run off the road by a garbage truck.

Love the zippers, access fro top or bottom making it easy to grab something from the pack without taking it off - using the bottom zipper. Great setup. 

Swapped the hose and mouthpiece out with an another and it works great.
review.name: Great Pack - not so great mouthpiece

name: Dirt Roamer 20L Pack

description: Buy the Metolius Rope Tarp online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Metolius Rope Tarp online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It doesn't have all the features I personally like for climbing outside and it is a little small. However, it's perfect for the gym. I throw all my stuff on it and drag it around the gym to the different climbs. I love it. When I'm done leading a route I pull the rope through the anchors and it lands perfectly in the bag, making a satisfying sound as it lands. And for the price who can beat it? It's the perfect gym climbing accessory.
review.name: The perfect gym climbing accessory

review.reviewBody: Awesome dual functionality of rope tarp and organization within the pack - the red loop also makes it super easy to not lose the business end of the rope at the crag :)
review.name: 5 Stars - Great addition to the pack

description: Buy the Nidecker Supermatic Step-In Snowboard Binding - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Supermatic Step-In Snowboard Binding - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nidecker Supermatic Step-In Snowboard Binding - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I'm a Snowboarding Dad in a family of Skiers so I'm sure we all know what the top of the lift is like. Kids screaming telling me it's time to go while I used to strap in. 

Now with the new bindings here, I just place my foot in and off I go. I did have to get a new pair of boots because my older boots just couldn't stand the pressure of the back hinge that clamps you in and took me a bit to get used to the step but they've been great!
review.name: LOVE THESE THINGS

review.reviewBody:
Spent $400 for a used one(photos), I guess I am getting a returned unit.
Since there is no more L size available, I have to keep this used one.
review.name: Spent $400 for a used one(photos)

review.reviewBody:
These are the best bindings I have ever had. Have only used them one day, and had no problems. Easy in and easy out.
Way faster and better than other rear entry bindings that I have owned,
Read the sizing chart prior to ordering. I didn’t and should have ordered large, the mediums work fine, but are close to the limit.
I recommend this product.
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: Works pretty well, a bit getting use too.  Still faster than straps, 3 to 5 times will click in properly.
review.name: Not bad

name: Supermatic Step-In Snowboard Binding - 2024

description: Buy the Camp Chef VersaTop Grill System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: VersaTop Grill System
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef VersaTop Grill System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used two times and now the regulator wont flow enough gas to get above a low flame.
review.name: Failed after two uses

review.reviewBody: I bought the versatop system believing the cult like devotion among Camp Chef fans. Very disappointed that the burner came detached from support after only a half dozen uses. It's no wonder- the burner is attached to thin horizontal plate with two small welds. It detached either during transit and/or was weakened by high heat. I tried fixing with heat resistant epoxy, but that didn't last long. The bummer is that I like the griddle otherwise and this could easily be fixed with a bracket and better attachment. I'm now looking for a replacement from competitors and taking this one to landfill.
review.name: Fatal design flaw

review.reviewBody: We can't wait to get the Artisan oven. I absolutely love cooking on this griddle.
review.name: Great Products

review.reviewBody: After having tjis for 2 years, worked great for I ur rv travels. Wish there was a cover to purckase. Ours finally died. Getting another, but want a case 4 it.
review.name: Love the temp. Works great.

review.reviewBody: I not only have the 17 inch flat top, but I also have the four burner griddle and the Windward pellet grill. I’m pretty much stuck on Camp Chef because of their quality and customer service.
review.name: Camp chef’s top of the line product

review.reviewBody: Returned it and bought the Blackstone 22 because it has a hood available. Too bad - Camp Chef is a better product. But having a hood makes a big difference in pre-warming and cooking some items.
review.name: Needs a hood

review.reviewBody: Spent an eternity trying to find a better connection to larger propane tank and after hours I found many solutions for blackstone and zero for this. Its going back and Im switching brands sheerly out of convenience.
review.name: Proprietary connections

review.reviewBody: I’ve used it three times and had it for a month before it basically stopped working. I followed all troubleshooting instructions from their website and it still won’t function properly….I was very excited but this has quickly spoiled my excitement….
review.name: Versatop 2x
comment: Hello and thank you for your review. We want to assure you that we truly are a company that stands behind their products and take pride in our customer support. Please reach out to customer service at support@campchef.com or 1-800-650-2433 and they will be happy to help as quickly as possible.

review.reviewBody: This thing rocks. Grilled veggies, smash-burgers, hash browns, all are wonderful. Can't do that on a charcoal grill.
review.name: Versa-Top Rocks.

review.reviewBody:
I really want to like my VersaTop. Purchased it because it has so much potential for other things. When we are camping in our smaller trailer every bit of room counts.

So far we have cooked several great breakfasts on it, and I look forward to trying lunches and dinners.

However, it may get left at home this season because CampChef does not include the proper hoses for an RV gas hookup and does not even have them available. This after specifically saying that it would work with low pressure RV hookups. I guess they did not lie, it will work if you can get the nonexistent proprietary parts and then combine it with a hose that costs half as much as the griddle does.

And even if we can get the part, who thought it was a good idea to have the gas port stick out three inches from the side of a portable griddle. I’m counting the days before that breaks off in my expensive Camp Chef carry bag that has no protection for the gas port.

Long time camp chef user - unfortunately this will end up sitting in the garage since I don’t want to carry a third tank or disconnect our RV tank to use it.

Oh, and the igniter does not work. Never has. I just figured that was a given for the overall poor design.

Poor design Camp Chef.
review.name: If you have an RV buy something else

name: VersaTop Grill System

hasVariant.name: District 2 Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch District 2 Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: District 2 Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch District 2 Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a Black District 2 as a personal bag for two weeks in Europe and now use it as an EDC bag. For everyday traveling, it worked great to carry my phone, sunglasses in a "sock", wallet or money clip, ID, keys, a pen with small pad, a small container of hand sanitizer, and a bottle opener. For larger travel days, I could add in a small power bank, charging cord, flashlight, and AirPods in their case. It was definitely full then and you noticed the weight through the strap. I could attach a water bottle or hat to the loops on the side with a carabiner too.

For EDC use, it perfectly fits my phone, wallet, keys, AirPods in their case, small multitool, hand sanitizer, and a bottle opener. It does not feel too full with those items.

The bag definitely broke in to be softer and less stiff. I love the orange interior, it almost lights up and is really easy to see within. The exterior material is really nice and feels refined.

My only gripes with the District 2 is that the adjustable strap would slowly lengthen over time, I had stitching slightly unravel on a pocket along the interior divider wall, and I wish there was a small grab handle. I think the strap issue appears if the bag is taken on and off a lot throughout the day, becoming slack temporarily. I fixed the stitching the way you would sew a button back on, just tight.  A mini grab handle between the base of the main strap would be very handy!

Awesome bag overall. If you think you carry my "big travel day" items regularly, then the larger version may be a better option.
review.name: Awesome Little Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought it for my daughter and she loves it! Great day bag with lots of room!
review.name: Great bag for everyday!

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag primarily to carry a couple of extra lenses and filters for my camera. It worked perfectly for that and I could not be happier. I also used it while traveling to put my earbuds, cough drops, pens, etc. in it, so I could store my carry on bag in the overhead storage of the plane/train, and still have easy access to everything I needed without taking up all of my leg room. I am definitely happy with this bag and it will go on every trip I take.
review.name: Great Compact Bag

review.reviewBody: I found this to be extremely handy for air travel, especially going through security. Everything is in one place - no fishing through pockets. My fear was taking it off and leaving it somewhere, but it’s small enough that I never felt the need to remove it.
review.name: Excellent for air travel

review.reviewBody: I got this for my wife she loves it for a bag to put her wallet in and other stuff it's light weight and don't take up space
review.name: Nice edc

review.reviewBody:
Thoughtfully designed.
The pocket for the phone is great.
There are no fasteners or metal to damage the phone.
I use the front small pocket for my keys,- perfect.
If I was going to make a design change , I would change the strap material.
All my winter coats are somewhat slick , so when wearing cross body - no issues  but if I am doing a quick on the shoulder errand - it slides.
I actually ordered another one for a gift. I loved it so much.
Thanks- job well done.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Great little bag for keeping all your valuables close at hand!
review.name: Excellent Bag!

review.reviewBody: I needed a light carry bag for a trip to Spain. Something that would work under my coat for passports, cash, and phone. This was an excellent option for that. Like with all MR gear, it was overbuilt, came in the mail quickly, and worked with zero issues; the product videos on the site where a tremendous help to get the right size.
review.name: District 2 in Spain - rocked it!

review.reviewBody: I got it to carry the things I have with me all the time in multiple pants pockets.   Phone, wallet, glasses all fit great.  I just tested it on a trip to London and I haven't put it down yet.
review.name: Great Murse!

review.reviewBody: This bag rocks! I can fit all my daily needs and it has so many pockets. I love the how easy it is to adjust the strap. Would recommend to a friend.
review.name: I love this little bag!

name: District 2 Bag

review.reviewBody: These are really great gloves. Comfortable and soft. I have worn them a few times on long ride and they hold up real well. Hope to get continued use for the forseeable future.
review.name: Great gloves!

review.reviewBody: Would love to revue put yet to receive these back ordered gloves. Stay tuned!
review.name: Sorry still waiting!

review.reviewBody: After only three rides, the stitching between the thumb and the pointer finger came apart.
review.name: Stitching around thumb came apart

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing PEARL iZUMi gloves for two years and found them to be excellent.  This brand new pair started unraveling at the seams in the palm during the first 4 hour ride.  In addition to that the pad is small and very hard,  so the gloves are not as nice as my previous pair.  Like the pad or not, the quality is not there where it counts.   What good is a glove that can't hold up for at least a few months.
review.name: STITCHING COMING OUT AFTER 1ST RIDE

review.reviewBody: I totally agree with Clarence and Louis.  The padding in the middle of the palm seemed like a good idea in the store but first, as Clarence says, there is no padding in or around the heel of the glove and since I ride on the hoods a lot, my hands scream at me after a short time into the ride.  Also, as Louis said, the padding in the palm feels like a lump after a while and I get a numbing sensation in my hands and thumbs.  Large size fits my size-9 hands well, they are comfy when not riding, and a little difficult to get off, but not too bad.  I wonder if this glove would work better on a flat-bar bike with no hoods?
review.name: Padding is Odd and not effective

review.reviewBody: Pearl Izumi Attack Glove (Black/Red) - This glove has a very unusual design feature. The palm area has an internal protector, a teardrop shaped, dense but thin rubber/plastic pad about 3 mm thick, perhaps 4mm in the center.. The outer layer of the glove, completely covering the rubber teardrop in the palm, is a very nice, super smooth, artificial suede fabric. As you look at the right palm (the left is a mirror image), the fat part of the teardrop covers the meaty part of the palm opposite the thumb. The small part of the teardrop is in the area where the thumb and forefinger meet. The unusual thing is this dense rubber pad is only moderately flexible, so when you grab the handlebar for example, the pad resists being bent around the narrow round bar. This has the unusual effect of requiring you to A) grip tighter than usual to completely enclose the round handlebar in your palm, or B)  allow the rubber/plastic pad to win as you loosen your grip slightly. The glove' (black) suede seems to really grip most handlebar rubber grips or road bike bar wrapping, but you are left with the feeling that a bump in the road would cause you to lose your grip on the bar. I kept squeezing then relaxing my grip during a 3 hour ride. The next day, I wore the gloves to the gym where I lift weights. The partially flexible palm pads insulated my (old) hands from the narrow, heavy bar, allowing me to lift more weight than normal because the bar weigh was distributed across my entire palm area rather than just the part directly below the narrow bar. Other than that, these gloves are extremely well made and very handsome. The back of the hand is covered with a breathable synthetic fabric (red) and the wrist secures with a narrow but effective hook & loop strap. I bought both XL and L sizes, I usually wear size L glove, but the Attack size XL was a perfect fit, so they run a size small.  4-1/2 stars.
review.name: Is unusual and new also great?

review.reviewBody: This pair of gloves endd up in a loaner box in the back of the car. There's no, maybe perhaps less than no padding in the heel of the glove. When I ride in the hoods which is 70% of the time my hands screamed at me.
review.name: LACKS SUPPORT

review.reviewBody: Have used Pearl Izumi gloves in the past with no issues.  Always have gone back to them because of their quality.  Some I have are 5-10 years old with hundreds of rides in them.  Bought these for road riding and had the same expectations as the previous ones.  They are decent, but started coming apart after 10 rides between the thumb and index finger.  Not the quality I've come to expect from Pearl Izumi.
review.name: Decent glove, but came apart

review.reviewBody: They were warm enough to the high 50s.. comfortable enough and fit to size. The reason I purchased these was to have a very thin profile glove as "gel" types bother me excessively. This has no gel but there is a very large oval shaped cutout with extra padded material in the middle of the palm. It is very pronounced and after some months started feeling even more pronounced - eventually causing some odd thumb numbness. After 5-6 months of varying winter/spring sunny weather riding and mixed laundry washing the velcro also pretty much stopped working.
review.name: Mixed bag, fit well but low quality

name: Attack Glove - Men's

description: Buy the The North Face Inferno Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Inferno Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Inferno Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While the rest of this bag is GREAT... A serious design flaw is that this bag is built so it can only be attached to two single pads, not a double. Anyone who's getting a double bag this warm is likely not going to be pleased by the potential for heat loss caused by the inevitable gap between sleeping pads. If I use this bag with a double pad and just forgo using the attachments, I'm afraid the friction will wear holes in the very thin (silver not blue fabric as shown) at the back of the sleeping bag. If I remove the attachments to prevent damaging the bag, it will no longer be under warranty. I REALLY want to love this bag. The hood is also built so that, when released in the middle, it doesn't form a uniform hood. Thus people who snuggle and don't just sleep like planks next to each other might end up with cold heads. I don't want to return this bag, I want to love it for all eternity and go on many adventures with my partner. But considering the price tag (even with the veteran's day discount) I'm not sure it's worth it.
review.name: Mixed Feelings

name: Inferno Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Down

review.reviewBody:
Moves and rides perfectly.  I like the phone pocket on the right hip. It can get in the way if you are riding with a hip pack, but it's not awful.  

I got the green (kalamata plaid) but would be happy to get some more if I see other color options.  I'm not sure how it breathes in the summer... looks like it would.  I got it as a fall/winter riding shirt and I layer underneath it.
review.name: Rides great.  Looks sharp.

review.reviewBody: This is my new favorite jersey. It fits great and is very comfortable and I like the style. I've started wearing it for other outdoor activities that don't include biking.
review.name: My new favorite jersey

review.reviewBody: I'm riding Levi's Gran Fondo next Saturday, and for the past month I've been trying different combinations of clothing: a few combinations involved this MTB long sleeve shirt. I want something to block the sun that's also lightweight and helps evaporate sweat. I've been testing it on road and indoor trainer rides. It's fine outdoors. I've had to remove it on each indoor trainer ride: To be fair, I've had to remove every shirt within 10 minutes indoors. It will be my morning and late afternoon shirt for spring/summer/fall outdoor rides, unless UT drivers keep hitting cyclists, in which case I'll revert to my day-glow-yellow jersey.
review.name: Well made long sleeve with snaps

review.reviewBody: This button up looks great and feels better. It has superb movement in the arms for riding the trails. The side zip pocket is great for holding your glasses indoors or your phone when riding.
review.name: From Work to Trail Classic

name: Slickrock Long-Sleeve Button-Up Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Equipment Squall Hooded Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I really like this jacket, but in the end sent it back because it was a little too tight in the core for layering. Its lightweight but not as light as something like the Black Diamond Alpine start or mountain Hardwear Kor Airshell. It feels like a good jacket for scrambling in cool spring conditions or for hiking above tree line when its very windy out. But it didnt allow me to layer under it very well. Its too thick for warm conditions and not large enough for cooler to cold conditions that require layers.
At most a thin fleece vest. I tried it with an Atom LT vest and it works but feels a little restricting. The rest of the fit was great and the hood is really nice. Looks great too. If I had a little more room int he chest and core area I would have kept it. Really nice jacket if it fits your right.
review.name: Great Jacket, but not for Layering

review.reviewBody:
Been loving the squall for everything mountains! 
When climbing it cuts the wind while staying locked in under the harness, with no more muffintop creeping out of the harness. 
Its also great for backcountry skiing and h=the hood fits over all helmets!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super nice, materials are amazing.size is perfect.and loving how fun this bowls are.
review.name: Fun necessity

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The product was very durable. The bowl is very big and can hold a lot. Liquid does not spill. When clasped it is very easy to store and take with. The color is a nice touch
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bowl is perfect to use for camping. Its stainless steel therefore it is super easy to clean, its small and compact so it doesn't take up much space in your bag
review.name: Small collapsible bowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is easy to stow but nonetheless it is sturdy in that it has support at the bottom so that it would be less likely to slide off a table, etc. It looks like it wouldn’t hold much but it does hold 2 1/2 cups of water, but it does hold about 2 cups more comfortably. The two cups go to about just below the inner colored rubber liner. I’d reccomend this product.
review.name: Travel compact bowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cute little bowl! Perfect for roadtrips with my pups. They are really gonna love having a dish like this! It is collapsible and fits in the back of the seat in my car!
review.name: Portable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently tried the Detour collapsible stainless steel bowl. It's a great little bowl for camping, it's well made and easy to store and thats a big plus when camping. Easy to clean.  I am definitely getting a few more and recommending them to all my camping friends.
review.name: Great bowl for camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice bowl. It's a decent size for a meal and easily packable. This was easy to clean. I think this will become a travel staple! I also think this would be nice for pets!
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is very durable and nice that it is collapsible, we are going to use as a dog bowl while camping. Could also be used to prep or cereal or whatever else. We don’t use bowls much when camping so dog bowl is perfect!
review.name: Dog bowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I picked this up to give to my husband for when he goes hunting and camps overnight. He used it last weekend and plans to bring it with him the next two. He loves that it's lightweight and packs really well. He used it for backpacking meals since it's much easier to eat them out of a bowl than the bag they come in and says the bowl fits a full meal pretty well. It's also easy to clean with hot water from a jet boil. Bonus that we got the bowl in his favorite green color!
review.name: Super portable and easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Detour Collapsible Bowl is very durable. It is made very well and conveniently collapses to almost flat. It will slip into a small pocket in your backpack for easy carrying. I received the medium-sized bowl, which is a bit smaller than I expected. The quality of this product is top of the line, the color is very nice, and the portability is exceptional.
review.name: Great quality & easy to carry!

name: Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible Bowl

review.reviewBody: The Glacier Half Zip fleece is a classic that works well for relaxing home, camping, hiking in cooler climates or any other casual activity.I just bought another two of these shirts and did so because the two I have are my favorite everyday shirts for cooler weather. They are so comfortable and do the trick to keep me warm. I usually wear a medium in Colombia and find these are a bit loose but I like that I can add a layer under if needed.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my  new very favorite piece of clothing. 5'9" 130 bought a small. Fits like a glove - which is what I was going for. Cozy. Sleeves and torso length long enough. I find I'm planning my wardrobe around it. Wish it came in more colors! I already also bought the blue.
review.name: My New Favorite Top

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and functional but not the most flattering jacket. Recommend for layering.
review.name: Jacket

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for YEARS for a fleece that was long enough in the torso and had long enough sleeves to replace my favorite fleece that finally wore out.  This style checks both of those boxes.  I am 5'8" with a slender build and I must have longish arms because I often find that sleeves are a little short for me.  I also want something that covers my belly and doesn't ride up.  I bought one of these in a small last year and loved it so much that I bought 3 more!  I wear them all the time over t-shirts, they are the perfect weight and a nice slim fit for me.  I generally wear a small in tops so this seems to run true to size.  If I liked a looser fit, I think a medium would also work.  The fleece is soft and doesn't have a pilling problem or look flat and sad after a year. The ONLY thing I don't love is the width of the neck, sometimes when it's fully zipped it ends up around the outside of my chin and I have to push it down because it feels weird up there.  I don't think it impacts the warmth or the look, I just wish it fit a little bit more snugly there. Obviously it's not a dealbreaker for me though, as I gave away all of my other fleeces and wear only these now!
review.name: This is my favorite fleece!

review.reviewBody: Hard for me to find a light weight fleece that isn’t too warm to wear, but this one is perfect weight. I also like Patagonia, but often their women’s sizing bells out at the bottom on me. This one not so much - fits better without being fitted.
review.name: Lightweight fleece at great price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super cozy and great fit. I found it very comfortable and I love it.
review.name: Great pullover

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the softness and comfort this sweater brings. It keeps me snug during winter time but also breathable. I highly recommend this product
review.name: Comfy sweater

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great color!  Quality and fit surpass expectations
review.name: Good must have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great! Wish I had more money to get a second one!!
review.name: The coziest!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfy, cozy but doesn’t make you too hot either. It’s a good sweater
review.name: Great

name: Glacial Fleece IV 1/2-Zip Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: Never had hot feet before these shoes and it makes sense it’s mostly a plastic dress shoe with no mesh.  The holes in the tongue are open but the ones on the side are fake.  I poked them open to let more air through.  Fit is pretty good, I was worried they’d be super narrow but not bad.
review.name: Fashion first shoe

review.reviewBody:
I’ll keep it short and sweet:
- I love the grip and walking ability in these shoes (feel safe and grippy)
- the laces are terrifying and I have to tuck them in my shoe (which gets uncomfortable) because if I don’t they catch in the chain
review.name: Mixed Views

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, very comfortable.  Easy to walk around in when off the bike. Great price.  Liked the neutral color.
review.name: First pair of cycling shoes

review.reviewBody:
I've had these shoes for about a month now. Several long rides, no issues. I've never been a fan of clipless pedals because the shoes are never wide enough for my feet. They feel like I'm footbound in narrow, uncomfortably stiff shoes. These aren't the widest but they fit. I bought them for a gravel race I'm doing. I don't usually clip in. I like riding flats but these are really nice. 

I would not pay $150 for them but I got these on sale for $90 and I would highly recommend them. I like the laces better than the boa.
review.name: Great so far.

review.reviewBody: I broke my rule and used these straight out of the box for mtn biking event, a 35 mile ride sponsored by my local mtn bike club. I hurt in many places 4 hours later but my feet was not one of them. I love the wide toe box and they clipped in and out no problem. I’m 58 and have been riding and racing xc and cross, mostly riding, since 1992. These are my new favorites.
review.name: Worked great straight out of the box

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a 2-hole-cleat (SPD) shoe for use with shimano ES600 road touring pedals for my road bike. Why? I wanted the feel of a road pedal and shoe that I could also wear and walk in comfortably off the bike when stopping for a cool one. My rides are mostly less than 2 hours and totally for pleasure, so I didn’t need a top performing ultra stiff SPD-SL shoe.  The Giro Privateer Lace is that shoe.  While it is positioned as a “mountain bike shoe”, it is similar in fit to my Giro Empire E70 SPD-SL road shoes, but with a sole that allows me to walk on pavement and floors without slipping or duck-walking.  I’m a 9.5D with a higher arch and the 43 is snug but comfortable. I’m a fan of laces as Velcro can wear out and BOAs are convenient but add cost. Laces can be adjusted for my foot shape, the lace garages on these shoes keep the ends out of the way, and lace shoes are not only less expensive but also don’t look out of place at the pub.  The olive/gum color looks pretty good too. With the discounted price I’m happy and recommend these as a “mountain bike shoe” you can walk in that works as a decent recreational road shoe with SPD cleats/pedals.
review.name: A 2-hole-cleat shoe for the road

review.reviewBody: I have 4 x 20 miles gravel rides w/ these shoes so far. Laces have yet to loosen during a ride. No numb feet. Comfortable. True to size. Zero complaints. Five stars for the money. Paid $110 for the purps color
review.name: Great shoes for the money

review.reviewBody: Got these as my first pair of mountain bike shoes after many pairs of road shoes. They are comfortable with a snug fit and spacious toe box. The laces look good and seem to conform to the foot better than BOA systems. Compared to carbon sole shoes, at least the road version, these have a fair amount of flex when out of the saddle.  Sizing matched the chart, same as my Lake shoes. Good value on sale.
review.name: Comfortable and look good...

name: Privateer Lace Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wanted a thicker tape for gravel riding and gave this a try.  the 4.6 is thick but thats what makes it good at soaking up vibration!  Good grip.  Easy to work with.  Here's my bars wrapped using the tapeless method.  I don't ride on the tops unless Im climbing, so I just wrap to the corners.  AXS remote blips mounted for shifting while climbing.
review.name: Good Gravel tape, easy to work with.

review.reviewBody: Got this tape cause I wanted something thick for padding my hands but this tape is so thick it makes it hard to wrap and looks ungainly on the bars. It made the bars look almost comical because they looked so big with the thick padding, and ended up not being super comfortable to hold.
review.name: Too Thiccc

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts out of all of Salomon's options! More so because they are somewhat 'mid-rise'. However, the fitting is a little tough to nail down because the waist runs a little big and there are no adjustable straps. BUT - they are light weight and I love training in these and even racing in these!
review.name: Great Shorts!

review.reviewBody: I bought these shorts a couple months ago and they are awesome! My favorite Solomon shorts! I love the color and they are so light! I thought they fit true to size and feel nice to run in!
review.name: My favorite Salomon shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts are the whole package, comfy, soft fabric, built in underwear that actually covers everything and doesn't ride or bunch. I love the cut along the side allowing for free movement.
review.name: I've worn a lot of running shorts!

review.reviewBody:
Bought for my wife as i have a few pairs, we’ve since recommended them to friends.

The could do with a zip pocket to hold a car key but great short all the same.
review.name: Perfect short

review.reviewBody: My sibling has a pair of these in large, so I was able to take a test run in them. The waist was loose and I had to keep pulling it up but the thighs felt comfortable. I figured I needed to size down to a medium but the waist is still big, and now the legs are tiny. It’s annoying that these don’t have a drawstring, the  large would fit better if I could cinch the waist tight. If you are a fuller waist and thin thighs these will be perfect for you, but if you’re anything like me, and have a slightly smaller waist and large size, these will not work for you
review.name: Really wanted these to work
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite shorts! I love how airy and breathable they are. They're also the lightest shorts I've ever worn!!!
review.name: Super Airy

review.reviewBody: These are great! The split is just right… enough range of motion but not a deep enough split to make it feel like you’re exposing yourself to the world when you run. I can’t wait to race in these.
review.name: Love the split!

review.reviewBody: I was hopeful for these but they fit so off. First off, I am a true to size M and the biker style size M shorts I ordered are BIG on me but these, sized up to a L, were still tighter in the waistband and the fit around the thighs was so off. There is not enough fabric so the front part of the shorts bunches up before you have a chance to even run. Very disappointing.
review.name: I wanted to love these
comment: Hey, we appreciate you taking the time to provide feedback on your recent purchase of our shorts, and we're truly sorry to hear about the fit issues you encountered. Your input is invaluable as we continually strive to improve our products. And we´ll certainly review our sizing guidelines to ensure accuracy.

review.reviewBody:
Bought for my wife - she now has two pairs. 

She loves the material, the feel and breathability. They’re lightweight and dry quickly.

Perfect shorts!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I have worn these shorts a few times now and they are super lightweight! They will be the perfect short for when the temperatures start to go up. I didn't experience chafing (although I did put non-chafing lube on too). There is a front pocket that works for gels or keys. A drawstring would be nice, but they still held up perfectly fine. review.reviewBody: I have recently begun the process of backcountry snowboarding.  The snowshoes are a great alternative to split-boarding.  These snowshoes are really fast and effective on hard-packed/groomed snow, but a little difficult in the soft and untracked stuff.  I am faster on groomed than the guys I hike with on skiis and skins, but they are certainly faster on the unbroken trails than I am.  I love the flexible yet aggressive stance of the shoe, and I love the heel riser.  I wish there were a second stage to set the heel riser higher for steeper slopes.  All in all, I love the shoes!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I had these for a full season.  They are great snowshoes, have done a few back country hikes up ascending and descending mountains.  I like the ease of getting into and out of them.   I was using a pair of MSR Evo ascent, but dislike that it was a buckle system, so it took a while to get in and out of them.   With the TSL, it was a boa and binding setup.   

Yesterday, I ended up doing a backcountry hike and the boa system clip broke.   I had to use nylon so that I wouldn't be stranded.   The snow was deep and soft and walking out on foot would have been miserable.    Good Snowshoes, but there is a weak link on the boa system.
review.name: Great Snowshoes, Almost perfect

name: Symbioz Hyperflex Adjust Snowshoe

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The nature of my work means I go through a brand new pair of boots every 12 weeks. These lasted 13. Comfy, and lightweight and good for rock climbing between volcanic glass scrambles. The best part, no breaking in period. However, bought a new pair, same size as before and they are about 1.5 sizes too big which is weird because my feet actually got bigger this year because I also have to wear steel toes boots regularly and the flat soles spread my sole out. Anyway, the point is, I sized down half a size and then they were slightly too small. They have gotten a bit better with use but the breaking in period has been loooong. So, though I still think the boots are stellar, as far as construction but as a lifetime La Sportiva customer I think their sizing has gotten a bit hinky so just... Be really careful in picking your size and also don't plan a big trip until you have worn these for a couple weeks on walks around the block at least.
review.name: Mixed

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these for a Mt. Hood summit and they are amazing. They are comfortable right out of the box, and very light weight. The four season boots are much heavier, and I find that the three season boots offer nearly the same protection and benefits, but are much lighter and more comfortable.
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these mainly to do glacier transit with semi automatic crampons.  And to do some mountaineering and high difficult trekkings , I did a great research before buying.
 These where SUPER while they where new, they are a really perfect boot. I can stay I used them a lot, but keep them just for the most difficult trails since I didn't want to wear them for regular hikes. A year later, the sides (interior and exterior) from both shoes started to wear down and as a result stopped being waterproof. I don't get why they wouldn't add any kind of extra protection in that point where you get the boot always flexing.... 
I had to stop using them on ice and snow because because my feet get wet, and they are now my regular hike boot.... 
They are super comfy, great grip, and not too heavy but the fact that they won't last more than one year is not what I was expecting from these.
review.name: too fragile

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are durable, warm and waterproof. I use these for winter conditions mostly during SAR callouts. I purchased them because they are crampon compatible but I have only used mico-spikes and have not needed crampons. I normally wear 7.5 shoe in other brands I have these in 39.5 and they fit perfect with Smartwool hiking socks.
review.name: Durable

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have used these boots for about four years now; they are versatile boots for hiking in summer and winter and seasons in between, at least in the Adirondacks and other parts of Upstate NY. I've worn the boots down to -20 and my feet stayed warm which is not an easy feat given that I have Raynaud's disease (poor circulation). Additionally, the boots are waterproof evidenced by the many wet/flooded trails I have successfully hiked thru without issue. The boot runs narrow and is low volume.
review.name: Great all around hiking boots for all seasons.

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wore these boots a significant amount on a glacier in Alaska, and learned that they are an excellent lightweight trekking boot, but are really difficult to climb in. I would typically switch into a heavier boot with an actual shank in it for vertical terrain, but for relaxed glacier hiking, these were excellent.
review.name: Good Trekking Boot

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this last week with the goal to hike a 14’er via a class 3 ridge ( involved minute climbing ).. These shoes did not offer support on my soles, they did not offer support around my ankles. They also were slipping against the rock in the few areas I did climb. It’s a nice shoe for tiny hikes and your commute to work in the snow. But for the price, I was thoroughly disappointed.
review.name: Be careful

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The new La Sportiva Trango Tech GTX is a lightweight and flexible boot particularly suitable for alpine hiking, technical approach routes and work shoes for mountain guides and rescuers.
review.name: La Sportiva Trango Tech GTX video

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fitting, comfortable shoe. I love the fit around the ankle. Good for long days in the back country.
review.name: Exactly what I wanted it to be

hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Strive MN 16 Ski Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The retro look on this binding is cool but the boot to ski transfer is fantastic
review.name: Great boot to ski transfer

review.reviewBody:
This new binding and specifically the toe piece is the result of Salomon looking to improve not regress. It offers excellent compatibility with the various toe lug shapes so it saves a lot of hassle and confusion when it comes to potentially picking another boot down the road. 
The toe offers an excellent blend of the elastic travel the STH toe was known for, but a similar lateral stiffness to the Warden MNC toe. Basically power transfer meets smooth sailing. It is slightly lower than the Warden toe stack height so you get the benefit of better snow feel on wider skis as well.
review.name: Well thought out upgrades!

review.reviewBody: The new strive 16 brings the same confidence and performance of the MNC but is lighter and seems like its a bit more connected to the ski.  The binding skis flat, without any noticeable toppling forward feeling.
review.name: Great improvements

review.reviewBody: After getting a sneak peak and a couple days on the Strive 16 near the end of last winter. I really enjoyed skiing it on the all new QST 106 and comparing it to my older 106. The new strive I get a better on snow feel as I am closer to the ski and closer to the snow. The thing I love about all Salomon bindings is how easy it is to step in and the sound it makes. Once I am clipped I know I am ready for a fun time in the trees, bumps, park, groomers.
review.name: Closer to the Ski Closer to the Snow

review.reviewBody: dependable salomon product. feel confident when in extreme conditions.
review.name: light and streamline look

review.reviewBody: This binding has changed ski feel for me. It offers a very close to ski feeling and power transfer is exceptional. The strive manages to achieve this in such a lightweight and durable package, it will be my binding of choice for years to come due to it's superior ski feel and elastic travel.
review.name: Elastic Travel is the name of the game

review.reviewBody: I’m not easily contained… but they held me down. Finally, some security in this unsecured world.
review.name: They held me down

name: Strive MN 16 Ski Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody:

- Quick and easy to put on (and take off). 
- My feet don't slide around or move forward in the bindings

Lightweight, durable. I have warm fuzzy feelings for this product.

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great for hiking or walking the dog but still just running errands.
review.name: Versatile shoes

review.reviewBody: These are literally the best shoes ever! I have a really hard time finding shoes that will work for me and not make my feet hurt after long wearing times. I wear these for walking, zumba, and just all day use. My feet have not hurt yet, even when jumping around in Zumba. I think I have high arches, so these must be good for that. Also, plantar's fascitis. The colors are beautiful. I just love them. Thank you!!
review.name: The best shoes

review.reviewBody: Fit well. Comfortable.no pain.12 hours on my feet!
review.name: Excellent fit..feels great.on my feet 12 hours

review.reviewBody: Very comfy shoe and great for walking, jigging or working out in the gym. I also have the mid version and I used it on a backpacking trip. It gave me enough support and helped with the plantar fasciatus that I had at the time.
review.name: Comfy!

review.reviewBody: I've had this pair of shoes for a few years now and I'm just needing a new pair now! They are so supportive and hold up very well, I wear mine everyday for my 8 hour shifts on my feet all day.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Decent price, great for orienteering (tough terrain/woods), running sneakers
review.name: Good running sneakers for woods

review.reviewBody: The best walking shoes I’ve ever owned! Stiff enough for any terrain but also light enough for errands and everyday use. Absolutely love them!
review.name: What a great shoe!
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Love them! I wear a size 9 in heels and the 7.5 fit me perfectly. I usually wear an 8-8.5 in sneakers depending on the brand. I like my sneakers very snug with no wiggle room in the toe area and these were perfect.
review.name: Light and Comfy

review.reviewBody: I just bought my second pair of Antora 3. These are really nice shoes! I walk my pups 4 miles every morning on hilly dirt roads, covered by rocks. The vibram base is durable and prevents slipping on loose rocks or wet roads. I am really impressed with these shoes! Hey are comfortable, and fit my orthotics inside. I was hesitant at first to purchase them, since they were marked down. I love them so much I bought another pair!
review.name: Great shoes, great price

review.reviewBody: They are comfortable. For someone with bunions and a hammer toe....me . There is enough room in them. I definitely recommend
review.name: Comfie

name: Antora 3 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: The shoes are great I own 4 pair and would continue to buy them when I need a new pair, they are durable, comfortable, and have three colors for style!
review.name: RideConcept Shoes Vice

review.reviewBody: These shoes definitely run small but I asked the customer service rep and he told me they were true to size. I do like the way the shoes look but. They don’t have a ton of grip either. Maybe the sole will soften up to help with that. My only hope is they stretch as they get broken in. If not, I’m out $100 bucks.
review.name: Not all that imp

review.reviewBody: I think I have somewhat wider feet and after a long day of riding my feet felt a little cramped and very hot. Also the rubber sole doesn't seen to stick to the pedals as well as some other flat shoes I've worn before this painr
review.name: OK Shoe

review.reviewBody: Best shoe I?ve rode with. Perfect mix between vans and five tens. Comfortable to walk around in. Good sense of feel for the pedals, but not to flexible like vans. They don?t stick quite as much as the five tens. Which is good makes it easier to readjust your feet on the pedals. Size was true to what I normally wear in vans or five tens.
review.name: Best riding shoes yet

review.reviewBody: These Ride Concepts are a fantastic shoe. Very well made and durable. I found the fit to be a bit narrow for my wide feet. I went up a size to 11 and that worked great. Gave the 101/2 to my son who loves his. The recessed dimples are incredible. A flat pedal bites right into these and holds your foot like glue. Highly recommend this to flat pedal riders!
review.name: Excellent shoe

name: Vice Shoe - Men's
