review.reviewBody: I have a wider foot so it's nice to have a shoe with that option.
review.name: Great fit and adjustment features

review.reviewBody: Purchased the Blk on Wht (wide fit) size 43, should have gotten 42.5. The wide model runs a bit large (just under 1/2 size). Very comfortable, extremely roomy, flexible, light & did I mention comfy? Love these shoes, will continue to use UFN.
review.name: Wonderful Shoes

review.reviewBody: No matter where you position the cleat on the shoes, you will feel the specific position pressure of the cleat through the sole. Never experienced this with any of my other shoes. There is almost zero pressure distribution through the sole.
review.name: Painfully uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: Just received these today. Wow, very impressed with the quality of materals, design, and construction. The fit is perfect. I purchased the white in 42.5. I have learned that I absolutely must buy only wide option shoes. My feet are more square shaped than the normal tapered foot, and these fit so well, are so comfortable. I can tell by the quality that they will last a long long time.
review.name: High Quality Shoe

review.reviewBody: Grabbed these in the “wide” version perfect if you are looking for cleats with more space! No more numb toes
review.name: Great Value!

review.reviewBody:
Most comfortable road shoes for wide feet. Easy to adjust. Just make sure you have the correct measurements for your foot WHEN splayed as if you were standing on the pedals. (Foot gets wider and sometimes longer). Lakes size chart with proper measurements is spot on. 
One issue is that Lake wide shoes can cause over pronation if you don’t set up your cleats properly. I had to move the cleats more to the middle (side to side) with the minimum shoe/crankarm clearance to keep from some pronation.
review.name: Great road shoe for wide feet

review.reviewBody:
Dissappointingly the length is about 1/2 size shorted BUT the toe box width is HUGE. Its like when they designed these they wanted to use the same amount of material. Theory:if its wider, it must be shorter so the same amount of material is used. 
  I have 4 other pairs of wide Lakes. They are all not wide enough (for me) but the length of toe box is perfect. O, I'm talking about a size 46.5. I assumed that these would be the same size as ALL OTHER lakes BUT WIDER. NoT THE CASE here. I love them but I cant do century rides with them on because my toes cramp up due to lack of space in toe box area. So I cant dress in a red color coordiated outfit for long rides. Bummer!
review.name: NOT THE SAME SIZING AS ALL OTHER LAKES

review.reviewBody: By far the most comfortable cycling shoes I’ve had.  I’m normally a size 13 US wide or extra which is usually a 47 EU, but ended up with size 48 EU with this shoe.  I have a wide foot but also oddly shaped where I experience pressure along the outside of the big toe pushing up against the toe box.  With these shoes that does not happen.  I cycle in hot humid conditions in FL with no issues. These are my first shoes with double BOA  and really like the flexibility they provide for tightening. Will be getting a second pair and hope Lake keeps making these and adding different color options.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got a pair of these with great anticipation of the wide fit helping my crushed toes.  Immediately had an issue.  The heel is also wide.  I got heel strike on the crank arms every revolution.  I even tried moving the cleats all the way to inside to accommodate and no dice.  Never had this with any shoes before.  Had to return them.
review.name: Wide heel did not work for me

review.reviewBody:
Had a Shimano RC7 size 46 before this shoe which was just to tight, think 46.5 would have been just right
So with that in mind I bought this shoe 46.5 which was a bit to big, so I think a 46 would have been perfect fit for me in the Lake Brand
I know now for future reference what size to buy in these brands 
I have used this shoe I while now and I'm not pleased with the quality of the material. I sweat a lot, so when I'm done with a workout shoes are all wet. After about 6 months or so the material started cracking and breaking. The Shimano I used it for about 2 years and that did not happen.
So sizing was e trail and error on me, but I was very disappointed in the quality 
Not the best shoes if you sweat a lot
review.name: Not the best for heavy sweaters

name: CX238 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Z Sling online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dry Creek Z Sling
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Dry Creek Z Sling online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Use it in salt water over 100 nights a year. Main compartment was remarkably waterproof for 2 seasons so much so that if the water rose higher than the bag i would float. It now slowly leaks when submerged despite me routinely lubricating the seal. Once saltwater gets in you have to clean everything stored inside the bag plus the bag itself so not really worth using anymore. Additionally the outside pocket zipper corroded after a year of use. The pocket is now stuck shut. Overall I like the design, the straps keep it in place when casting a surf rod and liked being able to slide it to in front of me to access the contents without taking it off. Unfortunately it didn't hold up which is what I expect when spending extra on Simms.
review.name: Great while it lasted

review.reviewBody: Good waterproofing. once you get used to the straps you can dial in a system of how you best want to sling and swing it. could use an additional set of mesh pockets opposite the others inside. Keep use the included lube for the zip closure if it gets dry over time. I use the lanyard attachments for my large net and my plier/forceps rig.
review.name: Mu go to in fringe weather especiially!

review.reviewBody: I used it on my recent fishing trip to Christmas Island and lived it
Use it alot where where deeper wading is a must especially salt water
review.name: Keeps essentials dry

review.reviewBody: Zipper is hard as hell to open, super inconvenient to use as a guide
review.name: Super inconvenient and annoying to use

review.reviewBody: May be returning it, first off great construction, however getting the net in and out is a night mare and it does not hold a standard net without constantly falling out . poor net design
review.name: poor net pocket design

review.reviewBody: Stays on my back really nicely. Perfect size for a day on the water. Zipper works well and Looks great. Another great product from Simms!
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Looks like a great bag I haven’t really had a chance to use it yet. I bought this to carry stuff while traveling to fishing destinations.

I fish mostly salt, Gulf of Mexico down to the Keys.  The pack is perfect for walking beaches and flats sight fishing.  The color is perfect.  Blends in with everything and does not conduct heat as much as my previous bag. I 100% reccomend this bag if you are a minimalist and fish in the extreme that require extra clothing and hydration.  Holds my H2O rain gear, GPS two 6x4 fly boxes and extra reel, leaders and first aide.  The only improvement I would make is to add an adjustment to the top of the shoulder strap so you can adjust exactly where the tool and fly patch go on your chest, but more importantly have the ability to dial in where the second wrap around strap comes around under your arm.  I am a big guy and the straps are more than long enough, just wish I could get it to connect a couple inches low.  Not a game changer, still comfortable, but it could be improve.
review.name: Fish year round.  Bag is high qaulity and rugged  100%  Reccomend

review.reviewBody: NOT completely waterproof.  The top pocket will let in water if it gets wet. I use this in the surf and a hit from a wave guarantees water in the top compartment.  I contacted customer service and they thanked me for letting them know..
review.name: Not  Completely Waterproof

name: Dry Creek Z Sling

review.reviewBody: I used to be a small, but gained a little weight.  I tried a medium, and the waistband was great.  Plenty of stretch to be comfortable.  My legs are pretty thin, but the leg band fit like a small.  I could fit, but expected these to be bigger, and unless you have tiny legs, these don't seem like they would be comfortable for most!   Then the chamois seemed too big.  I tried sitting in them and could feel my sit bones didn't even hit the cushy part of the chamois.  I guess I should still be wearing a small!   I am 5'7" and around 130 lbs with a bit of a tummy!
review.name: Too big and too small!

review.reviewBody: Waist band fit well, the fabric I would lean to "compression fit" it didn't have much give, specifically in the thighs.  While I do have larger quads, I've never had other shorts be too small in the thighs...
review.name: Wanted to like them

review.reviewBody: I am very pleased with these shorts.  I have struggled to find shorts for everyday use that fit me properly.  As a short woman, barely five feet tall, I find that most shorts are too long and thus hang loose on my thighs.  These hug my thighs well.  They?re lightweight and very comfortable as well.  Though not inexpensive, they aren?t as pricey as some of the other brands.  I wasn?t familiar with this manufacturer, but was actually referred to them by another company whose shorts did not fit me properly.  I will check back to see if there are tights that also meet my needs.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody: I wear an 8.5 in Speedcross, so I assumed the Thundercross would be the same. they are not. It appears they are perhaps an entire size or size and a half off. I am disappointed I have to send these back and wait for a new pair in my size.
review.name: Sizing is off
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of the Thundercross. I initial purchased these because I found my Lone Peaks by Altra weren't great on the wet muddy trails. But now I been running in these on all type of trails and have become my favorite! I have wide feet and found these pretty roomy I did size up 1/2 size to give me a little extra room in the toe box.
review.name: Daily Trail Runner

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn these for about a week, averaging about 5 miles/day in them. My heels got torn up on the first day, and I’ve been wearing bandaids ever since. I’m hoping that I’ll be able to break them in soon. I never had this problem with my old Speedcross 6 shoes. Also, I feel like the fit is not quite as good. The toe box seems smaller. I’ll go back to the Speedcross next time.
review.name: Not as good as Speedcross
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience with the THUNDERCROSS. We’re sorry to hear about the discomfort you’ve encountered and appreciate your feedback regarding the fit. We will pass your concerns to our design team, as it’s important to us that our shoes provide the right support and comfort.

review.reviewBody: I switched from the Speedcross (which is also a great shoe) over to the thundercross because I do more walking than running. This shoe feels more stable to walk in but still has the grip of a good trail running shoe. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought this style as the usual pair I buy was discontinued. To my surprise, I love them better than the usual pair I buy!. I love the traction and support of this style.
review.name: comfortable and sturdy

review.reviewBody: Don’t get these, had horrible blisters on my toes and heels after 2 miles. Switched shoes to finish out the hike.
review.name: Blisters!!! Beware
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I tried these shoes on once I had received them. I noticed that they run almost a size and a half too big for my feet. I did read the find my size page before purchasing and 7.5 is usually my size and should of been. Other than that, they are super comfy and cute!
review.name: Comfy, but runs big

review.reviewBody: I have about 6 pairs of these. Ran a bunch of 55k, ran the TMB in them. Have the gortex too. The transition from hoka Speedgoat to this was so easy. The drop is the same the shoe can handle anything and the lugs are way more intense than hokas. No wimpy mid foam in the bottom this is a good quality sole. Awesome rock protection during Eiger race and GTC. Stable, reliable, the one thing they could improve is the garage, I wish it went from the top like the Slab ultra Trail FDH.  Wear the shoes for about 15 miles to really decide how tight you want them.
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: Love these! Great comfort for being on my feet all day!
review.name: AMAZING!

review.reviewBody:
I have high arches & insteps and most cushioned shoes these days seem to made for flat feet, with a big drop, high stack hieght and low instep, which don’t work.  These shoes fit the bill nicely for highly cushioned shoes for people with high arches and insteps.  These shoes ar super comfy for long miles on good trails, but as expected due to the stack height and soft cushioning aren’t great on technical and super steep terrain. Also I had to size down 1/2  from my normal size in Salomon and other brands of running shoes

Only real complaint is these aren’t summer shoes.  They are noticeable hot when wearing when above 70* and I think sacrifice some needed breathaability for durability.
review.name: Good cushion & lower drop for non-technical trail

review.reviewBody: I just got my third pair of Holbrooks and the quality on them has gone down significantly despite them costing much more than my first two pairs. I cant believe how bad the plastic frames are now for a +$200 pair of glasses. You can feel and see the mold seam around the entire pair of glasses. It's sharp and pokes your ears when you put the glasses on. Astonished at how bad these have become after being in love with the glasses for the last 10 years.
review.name: Major quality issues

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace the Sliver line that I used to wear but unfortunately have been discontinued. This is my first pair of Holbrooks and I like them a lot. They fit great and are very high quality.
review.name: awesome glasses

review.reviewBody: The best sunglasses I?ve owned. I have had every high end pair of sunglasses since 1980, and, these are by far the best lens and fit I?ve ever had.
review.name: Oakley strikes again

review.reviewBody: First pair of oakleys. I figured the Prizm technology was along the lines or close to polarized, but it's not.  Not comparable to costa or Maui lens.  I would still recommend for everyday use driving or daydrinking ( not together)  especially at the sale price.
review.name: Good but not great.

review.reviewBody: These were given to me as a gift. They are absolutely perfect for me and the stuff I do. Ice climbing, winter backpacking and just for those cold days where you need a bit more than a shell. Pack down so small I don't even know they are in my pack until I need them. Super light weight. Great going on and off with the side zips so I don't need to take anything off or on but the pants. Warm and I mean warm. Great accessory to my kit when staying warm is a must.
review.name: Absolutely a great piece of gear!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Built well top to bottom. This pair of pants is very warm even when trudging through the snow. Full length zippers allow for ease of use on and off. They fit under a harness or over one. They fit well over big boots up to 8000m boots. They can get wet, tossed around, and generally beat up and they will be just fine. I wear them every single day in the winter at the crag and on snow machines. As well as on expeditions around the world including Vinson in Antarctica.
review.name: Very Durable!

review.reviewBody: This is by far my favorite pant! The fit is perfect. They offer huge range of mobility and just enough protection from the elements to make them the first pair of pants I grab for anything really. I’ve worn these around the globe and will continue to.
review.name: BEST PANTS !!!

review.reviewBody: These are excellent. The fit and stretch are making them fantastic for climbing. I like having the zipper pockets so I don't have to worry about stuff falling out of them. Looking forward to trying them out on an alpine hike!
review.name: Alpine Softshell

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable practical & durable

KUHL has so many great designs but do not hold up well to use & wear out to throw away too soon!

All my Mountain Hardwear pants are luxuurious and still hard at it!
review.name: Quality to Last

review.reviewBody: Great pants, like the comfort and fit.  Im 6 foot 235lbs and the Xl fits well.  I really like the multiple choices for inseam as i have shorter legs and long torso. I bought these with backpacking in mind especially with the built in belt. Ive had a couple people comment on that they are sharp looking.  Since i just got them and haven't tested them on the trail yet i cant speak to there quality but to what I see there made extremely well.
review.name: Great pants would buy again

review.reviewBody:
In the 25 years that I’ve been an athlete for Hardwear, I think these are the best pants they have ever made! 10/10 
The fit is perfect, with a conical waist articulated knees and pockets in the right places, with zips where you need them and the right size for large phones or anything else you might want to put in them. 
Hydrophobic, fast drying and stretchy - Boom 💥 Top marks for the technical outward designers that did the fine tuning on this one 😜🙌
review.name: Best yet ! Absolutely superb climbing pants 10/10

review.reviewBody: I have had these for a few weeks now. I really like the feel and stretch. As a bigger legged guy I always struggle with hiking/climbing pants being way too tight on me in the thigh region. I can say these have a great fit. For reference I am 6'4" and about 250lbs and bought an XL. The length is great and waist feels good. Pants breathe very well and I am excited to take them with me on some backpacking trips this spring to get a good feel for them. I also love the ankle tightening straps as I always prefer a jogger cuff style on my pants. I hope Mountain Hardwear adds more colors as I will definitely be getting another pair or two down the road. We will see in a few months the durability of these pants but so far they have a good build.
review.name: Great material and fit!

name: Chockstone Alpine LT Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good price, quick delivery and nice upgrade
review.name: Nice upgrade

review.reviewBody: No surprises here. The 203mm rotor is a substantial upgrade in stopping power. I swapped out my 180mm front rotor for this dinner-plate sized ring of Shimano goodness. Coupled with two-piston calipers, you can stoppie to your heart's content. Excellent feel and response; you can't go wrong. The only caution is that you could easily loop the bike if you are ham-fisted on the front brake on the steeps. So remember: when in doubt, don't grab a handful when only one finger can do!
review.name: They slow the rotation of Earth!

review.reviewBody: Bought this the first time and the lock ring was faulty. Backcountry said they didn’t stock just the lock ring so they sent me a whole new rotor and I had it in 24 hrs. Terrific service! Been dealing with Backcountry a long time and they never disappoint.
review.name: Great product and service

review.reviewBody: I have these on my gravel bike right now and they provide great stopping power and hold up great.
review.name: Great Brakes

review.reviewBody: Threw on my TCR at the recommendation of the good folks at CC. Great stopping power, Ice tech, superb weight, look great, nice upgrade. What more can you ask for!
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
Looks great on any bike. Seems to cool itself down well. Got the 160mm one which has 4 spider arms (not 5). 

If you are confused like myself: XT got silver rotor, silver fins, black spider. XTR got silver rotor, black fins, black spider.
review.name: Works great just like XT

name: XT RT-MT800 Centerlock Disc Rotor

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'2" and 180 lbs and the large fits me very well.  It's not super-tight, but an athletic fit and proportional such that the sleeves and neck are perfect.

It's warm and checks all the box wrt functionality.
review.name: Highly recommended

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable & stretchy.  I’ve only worn it a few times and it hasn’t been too cold yet so can’t speak too much on its insulating performance yet.  My only negative is that I wish it was a little longer.
review.name: Nice Gear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Material a bit too plastic foam like—wrinkles when you sit in it
review.name: Wrinkle foAm

review.reviewBody: A great layer for ice climbing or AT skiing in Alaska in early spring weather. The chest pocket is awesome for music or keys. The thumb holes are a must for any layer.
review.name: Great mid layer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this for a skiing baselayer but find that I wear it all the time. Great buy.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: The thumb holes are pure geometric genius.  They work amazingly well with gloves.  I now want all my fleece to have thumb holes now.
review.name: Gauss would be proud

review.reviewBody: Material is quite good but the cut is not athletic fit as advertised.  It is the same cut as the Rocklin which is regular fit. If you are looking for a tighter fit, it is disappointing. Also, the collar is way too large to provide warmth. I bought a small and expect the collar to be ~15". This is probably 16.5-17". I am returning this.
review.name: Fit is not athletic.

review.reviewBody: Great fleece, nice weight. Very stylish. Only annoyance  (from a picky husband) the collar is a bit stiff , stands up & bugs his neck
review.name: Stylish warm fleece

name: Olden Polartec 1/2-Zip Top - Men's

review.reviewBody: Our son in New Zealand purchased us a part of these slippers. After a few months they developed holes in the toes. Returned them for another pair, but those developed holes in the same location, even though the second pair was bigger. The location is where the wool from the sides come together at the toe. The manufacturing process creates a weakened thin area aslipperst this point. Now they say the are out of warranty. They also charged my son shipping to New Zealand when the slippers were shipped to New York. They issued him a store credit which he can’t use.
review.name: Design defect

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn a 46 for more decades that I can remember (or a ‘12’ here in the States), and I’d say these feel like they’re closized as 45s. I’ve already exchanged them for a 47, so I’m hopeful that they’ll fit.
review.name: They run small.

review.reviewBody: These are obviously high quality but I'm kind of disappointed. The wool felt feels itchy on my skin. Also, the lip on the back flicks my heel with every step. Maybe I needed to go a size bigger. But I like the sole.
review.name: A little itchy. Runs small.

review.reviewBody: The wool is warm and comfortable, but the slippers don't provide enough support for my feet.  If you are looking for a slipper to keep your feet warm, and support is not an issue, these slippers will be fine.
review.name: Not enough support

review.reviewBody: Can they even be called slippers? Yes, in form they may be slipped on ones foot, but in factor they certainly transcend all preconceived notions of the standard slipper archetype. These are not your grandmothers slippers. They are well-made, comfortable, dare I say stylish slipper-clogs. They keep your feet warm - but not too warm - the wool comfortably regulates temperature and wicks sweat (and is naturally antimicrobial, to boot!). I've practically lived in these since they arrived. Working from home has never been better.
review.name: Amazing "slippers"

review.reviewBody: Shoes seemed to be of good quality and were attractive looking and quite soft, however the sole lacks padding.  I realize it's a house slipper, but I wanted a little extra cushion and returned them for another brand.
review.name: Soft & relatively comfy, but lacking

review.reviewBody: I love these slippers… very cozy! I waited for cyber- Monday to buy them because they are a bit pricey…Sadly I had them only a couple weeks and my dog decided she loves them too!! Chewed up the leather sole while I was in the shower! Keep an eye on your doggie!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
These slippers are better than I imagined. My feet sweat a lot, and my old cheap department store slippers were horrible for heat regulation. These slippers are warmer, yet my feet have no°t sweat in them yet after several days of frequent use! Not to mention they may be the most comfortable things I have ever donned on my feet before. Plus they look even better in person than online (I got Denim, which, as I hoped, is accurately represented by the image online regarding color and does not actually look at al like denim), and I have only read good things about their durability! 

I would have never pictured myself spending so much on slippers, but here we are and I think it was well worth the purchase!
review.name: Worth the Money

review.reviewBody: The shoes are very cozy, but they have no support whatsoever. My arches are in pain after wearing for a month.
review.name: Wish they had some support
comment: Hey there! I'm so sorry to hear that the slippers aren't working out. Please feel free to reach out to our Gearheads, they can assist you with a free return or exchange, and even recommend alternatives for you!

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal slipper!  Very comfortable!  And I ordered a size which was a little too small. The return was simple and I had the right size within a day!  Great company to deal with. And I highly recommend these slippers!
review.name: Love them!

name: The Slip-On Leather Slipper

review.reviewBody: Very nice materials very easy to ride or hike. I likes the front large pocket mesh. Unfotunately, on my 1st trip the zipper glue failed completely and the material on one side peeled off as a banana. Maybe it happened bc it was sitting on a beach in full sun for 3+ hours? It's the last time I buy a pack without the sown zipper. After 3+ weeks still trying to get a refund from Black Diamond (bought from a store they run). So far they offered store credit...
review.name: zipper poorly glued

review.reviewBody: This harness is durable and comfortable from the beginning. Love it!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Plastic on the hard point broke after 5 months of regular use while hanging with a creak and crack scaring me. Still had redundancy but very scary.
review.name: Broke after 5 months

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable harness I’ve hung in. It feels super secure in the legs and hips and the gear loops are solid. For sport climbing outside, it’s the best I’ve used.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: This is my second marmut ophir 3 slide. I love using this at the gym. I am very novice so it is perfect for me
review.name: The Perfect Gym harness

review.reviewBody: Ordered this as a harness for my brother so he could climb with me. It will adjust fairly large (Men's 42 waist). No problems so far.

Great harness, durable, loops are fairly easy to access, and I like the adjustments on each leg. I do wish it came in more colors though. I always worry about accidentally leaving things behind when they aren't as bright or visible.
review.name: Solid Harness

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use for some gym climbing and it’s been great. I find three Ophir 3 Slide to be comfortable, lightweight, and durable enough for outdoor climbing as well. The gear loops are good sized and the harness fits just as expected.
review.name: Great Harness

review.reviewBody: I like this harness because I feel like I can send anything on the wall. I wish  adjusting this harness is a little easier but thats a minor con. Would buy it again.
review.name: Secure and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: The functionality and overall structure of this harness is great
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: great all around harness, pretty comfortable im 6'2 and the L size fits me when its sinched all the way
review.name: Great harness

description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Vela Double Quilt: 32F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vela Double Quilt: 32F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Vela Double Quilt: 32F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I took the Vela out with a double Exped 3R for 5 nights in the 40s and below so far and added shock cord as pad straps. Kept us warm by itself to about 40 true to comfort rating. I put a 50 degree quilt over the top and was warm at 30.great value.
review.name: Good double quilt

review.reviewBody: I've never been more obsessed with a piece of camping equipment EVER! I purchased this to use primarily on my own, knowing that I wanted space to move around as I sleep. I like to tuck my blankets around me and under my sides. It's warm, cozy, and I'm so happy with the size. It's great on my own and when shared.
review.name: An all-award winner

review.reviewBody: We purchased the quilt along with two neoair pads and the double sheet coupling kit. We're happy with the warmth and coziness of the new setup, as well as the major reduction in weight and volume for packing
review.name: Quilt, pads, and double sheet are a great combo

review.reviewBody: This quilt is fantastic. It’s big enough to wrap up in and stay comfy warm. We camped out for a week on the middle Fork of the Salmon River and we had some really cold nights. Easy to crawl out….much easier than getting out of a sleeping bag!
review.name: Vela Double Quitl

review.reviewBody: Appalachian trail in certain conditions over heated and other times warmth with comfort but tested out in a raw rainy night in Vermont Green Mountain at 36 degrees was a bit uncomfortable. In areas with Maine Appalachian weather it’s a no go in the 20 degrees zone.I found wrapping mummy style awesome all around heat and comfort. This is quilt fashion for two and yes like the advertising states tucks under pads etc but found myself feeling that raw air. But mummy wrap it ,awesome. So if you want some couple time on hiking bring solo mummy sleeping bags and have a cozy dinner instead . I have tested it out a lot. One person it’s really good it fumbles a bit in getting that heat to stay in between two sleepers. mummy sleeping bags best ever.
review.name: therma rest vela double

review.reviewBody: I love the idea, the shape, and the side baffles, but it's too light.  I have used sheets and a comforter instead of a sleeping bag for years, and thought this might be a replacement for the narrower comforter my husband and I have been using, and that it might be warm enough for spring/fall camping in the northern rockies (since it's advertised for 32F).  It's way too light, so I'm returning it.
review.name: Too light
comment: How warm did you find this bag?

review.reviewBody: My husband and I have exclusively used this quilt while tent camping this summer in Alberta, Canada. This jusssttt fits to life over the bottom of two Mondo Kings (L), coupled with the Synergy Coupler. We were both quite warm in just base layers and it probably got down to 5C overnight. I love it and will definitely buy the -6 version when it comes back in stock for some shoulder season camping!
review.name: Perfect for car camping in the summer in the Rockies!

review.reviewBody: This turned out to be a great purchase. Very warm tent camping in the upper 30's. Packs small and water resistant. No complaints.
review.name: Super cozy and convenient

review.reviewBody: Would agree with the 5C deg comfort rating - using light-mid weight base layers only. Around 0 needed mid to heavy weight base layer plus a fleece or insulated jacket. I usually run normal and close to most ratings. Unfortunately at 0, there's some leakage on the side - but this is a quilt and is not a seal like a traditional bag. Otherwise for what it's used for - it's comfy, light, packs decent size - provided stuff sack was easy to stuff, could probably go smaller if required.
review.name: Packs well, light, comfortable at listed ratings

review.reviewBody: Bought this last October and have literally used it almost every night since. Keeps me warm down to freezing, wearing a good base layer and down socks, even though its rated at 41Â°. I've wintered in NW Oregon, which is basically an arctic jungle. Low temps and high humidity. So the Nikwax down is totally the ticket for damp, cold conditions. Its held up and performed perfectly and would recommend. Going to by the new 20Â° Vesper for next winter. Best product I've bought in years. ;)
review.name: Just the ticket for car camping

name: Vela Double Quilt: 32F Down

review.reviewBody: I really like the show just wish you had different colors
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: What is going on with the colors of the women's trail running line??? It's impossible to find a nice colorway. These all look like men's. I love my Mach 6, Clifton, but wanted to replace my Torrent for a long time and I can't find a colorway that I can look at it for longer than 2 seconds without giving me eyesore. We want neutrals, black upper on light midsole and feminine colorways! Thank you.
review.name: Dear product line manager no more eyesore colorways

review.reviewBody: Feel so much better in my walks wearing these; imo hokas are always easy to break in without blisters or rubbing, one of the best shoe brands out there. I will be ordering another pair. I a
review.name: Easy to break in

review.reviewBody: Hoka are the best shoes I have ever owned. Extremely comfortable & supportive. I wear my Hoka shoes to the gym, hiking or just walking. Perfect!
review.name: Fantastic Shoes!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely loved the Speedgoat 4s. Yes the tongue was an issue, but overall it was a great shoe for me. The 5s were awful. You can fold them in half. Pick up a pair and try. I like more support underfoot and the 5s were way too soft. The 6s are great and closer to the 4s than the 5s. The traction is super secure, similar to the Mafate. I will run in the shoe because it works for me, but I absolutely hate the colorways. Obnoxiously overdone. I wear an 8.5 street shoe. I always wear a 9 in Hoka and it's the same for this shoe. I like a bit of extra length and have never lost a toenail.
review.name: Improvement from the 5s

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Speedgoat since version 2, skipping the year of the slicing tongue, loved the 5s. The 6s are a complete overhaul and it's not a good change. Most important is sizing changed, I was a 7.5 in previous Speedgoats, so that's what I ordered, they are too short. I should have gotten an 8, my toes hurt. Second, the tongue, why do you always change the tongue? Now it has an elevated/thickness right where you would tie the shoe, then the tie will slip unless you tie it very tight, then it feels like you are bruising the top of your foot while running. I don't understand the purpose of this change. I ordered Gull/Stormy skies color, it's interesting, wouldn't have selected if I saw it in person, I think it has snowflakes. Some positives: I like the heel cup, if feels more fitted, less pebbles are getting in my shoe. The improved grippiness of the soles are good. They are grippy. I'm really bummed with the changes and in the market for some new trail shoes.I think I waited too long to return so will probably have to sell them, unfortunately.
review.name: Loyal Speedgoat user for years and so disappointed

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes! It's my very first pair of Hoka's I have ever bought and I will definitely be buying them in different colors!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

review.reviewBody: This is her primary running shoe and she says it feels like she is running on springs!
review.name: I bought these for my wife and she loves them!

review.reviewBody: Didn't do anything crazy with them, but there's two spots where they have started to come apart. Just did a 4-day trail run around Wonderland and this is the result. Not the typical quality I expect when buying Hokas.
review.name: Coming apart after only 93 miles

review.reviewBody: I heard the new Speedgoats went down in quality but i ignored the complaints. I needed new fall trail running shoes so took a trip to R.E.I. to try the new Speedgoat 6, being a fan of the 5s. I was expecting to walk out with a pair of 6s, but the complaints were valid! They were shockingly uncomfortable! They are stiff and run small. They still had the Speedgoat 5s in the store so my friend and I put them on side by side. The 5s are roomier and the material is much softer. The material on the 6s felt like cheap plastic and when I sized up they fit the toe box but then rubbed on the heel. I tried on the Stinson 7 instead, which also didn't workout. They're plush on the foot, but stiff around the ankles and way too heavy and stacked for a trail running shoe. I was so disappointed. I ended up with the Challenger 7s, which are very comfortable, but I was hoping for a more technical quality trail running shoe. I feel like I should backstock the Speedgoat 5s...otherwise I might need to switch to a different brand. Hopefully the quality improves next time!
review.name: So disappointed...

name: Speedgoat 6 Wide Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: My my kiddo, we had always put her in smiths goggles. But as she got older we had issues with the lens fogging, gaps, etc. So we decided to try these. We did decide to get a high and low light pair so she didnt have to mess with a lens. And we love these. She has a smith helmet and there a no gaps, she can go laps, plow through pow, and hit the park and we have zero issues with them fogging up! So if you are looking for a reasonably priced but GREAT quality goggle, these are for you!
review.name: Great Buy!
